main event: A radar target was acquired at around 30,000 feet over Westboro, Massachusetts on June 8, 1961. The object appeared to be at around 12,000-15,000 feet and made a 180 degree turn, heading back east at a high rate of speed.
interesting points: The object was tracked on radar and a visual observer said it was very bright, brighter than stars.
The observer indicated that this was not a misinterpretation of an aircraft.
The object made a 180 degree turn and then headed back east at a high rate of speed.
The sighting lasted for around 30 minutes.
There were no photographs included in the report.
